Posts.Content: AdVance male sling surgery update ... I'm 1 week out from having the AdVance male sling surgery "installed" (3/13/2017). The dr said it all went well with no surprises (I guess that's good). I stayed overnight in the hospital ("23 hour" stay) and they took the catheter out the morning I went home. The pain wasn't too bad but I'm sure that was helped by the oxy-whatever-they-are pills I slept on the couch from Tuesday night to Saturday night as it was much easier to sleep propped up versus laying down and trying to get up and down felt like someone had a fish hook in the bottom of my right testicle and was yanking on it if I moved "wrong" or too fast ... as you can guess, it did NOT feel good! So the couch it was until last night. I've only been taking Advil and Tylenol since getting home - too worried about getting constipation like I had after the prostate was removed and they didn't tell me it would be an issue back then. The "fish hook" feeling is still there but to a much, much lesser degree (at only 1 week out). The 1st couple of days were great in regards to incontinence, the next couple, not so good. Today (3/20) is better. I'm trying to be real good and following the drs orders. He said to not lift more than 10-15 #'s and I've limited it to a gallon of milk which is 8.34 # when full. No bending to floor, squatting and don't spread legs apart farther than shoulders. Kind of a pain to follow but the pain will remind me if I do too much. Now that the wind storm and snow storms (Rochester, NY) are over, I can walk around the neighborhood in the evenings and I returned to work today (man am I tired!). So far I've been feeling better each day. I just hope it was the right thing to do! John
Posts.Title: Male sling incontinence surgery

Posts.Content: I'm ~15 months post radical robotic prostatectomy (Da Vinci) and still have both, stress and urgency incontinence. I've tried "all" of the medications for the urgency (and they were too expensive anyway). I've done the kegels and even tried reducing my intake of fluids. I go through 1-4 large pads a day, not soaked but quite uncomfortable to wear (and they leak if I let them go too long). The dr said I'm a good candidate for the AdVance male urinary sling surgery and says that it "should" get me back to where I was pre-sugery when I only had urinary urgency but no leakage and I could hold it until I got to a bathroom. I say the dr said "should" because he also said he makes no guarantees ... which I understand. I've changed my life because of this - I don't go on long walks with my wife because I can't hold back the urgency. I no longer go on Boy Scouts camp outs or other outings with my 2 boys and I have to be careful where I go, making sure I don't intake too many fluids and I always carry a spare pad in my back pocket. Has anyone had this surgery and what should I expect? Thanks, John

Posts.Title: Male sling incontinence surgery

Posts.Content: RobLee, From my understanding, the sling is good for men who use less than ~3 pads a day and is "permanant". While the artificial sphincter is considered the "Gold Standard" and good for men who are above that pad usage. However, I've read (and my Dr. told me) that the artificial sphincter has a 7-10 yr life expectancy and will need to be replaced (or repaired???) at that time. And true to point, my father in law is in that boat but he's too stubborn to see the doctor about it. My experience with kegels ... my physical therapist told me I was doing too many kegels and overworking the muscles (heavy sigh) ... I have no idea as I've heard it both ways ... do more kegels!!!! ... do less kegels!!!! ... you're squeezing the wrong muscles ... argh!!!! I'll let you know how it goes if I decide to go for it. BTW ... I'm "only" 51 Thanks, John

Posts.Title: Male sling incontinence surgery

Posts.Content: I know everyone is different however, what are peoples thoughts on Trimix gel? A low does of Trimix injection worked WONDERFUL in the drs office and it took 4 hrs for the erection finally go down. That was after my dr "threatened" me with the procedure to reduce the erection if it didn't go down on it's own. I've had the medicine in my fridge and I can't bring myself to use it. I'm not a "big guy" down there and it's gotten smaller since my prostate surgery. I keep thinking the needle will poke out the other side, not to mention the injection hurt at the drs office. I can get an erection myself but not with my wife (I have incontinence issues which really kills the mood) so I know "it" works. Thoughts? john Da Vinci done ~15 months ago and I'm 51
Posts.Title: Trimix gel

Posts.Content: Tybeeman, I've wasted 2 complete bottles of the meds in the fridge (with lots of un-used syringes - I had high hopes of lots of fun) and I've come to the conclusion that I will never ever use the needle. I can't stand needles in the dr office and I surely won't be able to use one myself "down there". Hence the gel question. I will be more candid with the dr next time about being able to get it going myself. It's easy to discuss on a forum where no one know's you but more difficult in person. Thanks
Posts.Title: Trimix gel

Posts.Content: While I appreciate the encouragement to try the Trimix injections and I know it worked really well that one time at the drs office I just will not do it. My wife was ready and (somewhat) willing to do it for me and as she got closer to me with the syringe I almost went into a panic attack. I never get that way. I have the auto injector which hasn't helped the anxiety at all. This is why I'm asking about the gel.

Posts.Title: Trimix gel

Posts.Content: Thanks SeaCock and Michael. I'm waiting for my dr to get the prescription to the company that does the pre-mixing. I'm also scheduled for another surgery (March 13th) for a male sling to help (hopefully fix!!!) the incontinence. Once that's under control, I'm hopeful that the erections will improve. It's a major turn off, to me, when I'm leaking and trying to "have fun" with the wife. Brave, et al. - what may be simple for some may be impossible to others for many reasons. As I stated, I will not use the needle, hence the question about the gel. Thanks all. I'll let you know what happens.

Posts.Title: Trimix gel

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies so far. I think the dr wants to do the surgery now(ish), instead of later, because I'm "young" and will recover quicker and easier. And yes, I don't remember how many da Vinci Prostatectomy's he's done but I do remember it was way up there and he's been writing articles on the procedure since 2004.
Posts.Title: Biopsy is positive for cancer ... now what?

Posts.Content: I had my 2nd biopsy in March 2015 (I'm 49 yrs old) and it came back positive for prostate cancer and the dr is recommending the da Vinci Prostatectomy since I'm on the young side for having PC. Long story short ... I'm worried about the incontinence thing more than almost anything else. I already take Tamsulosin (Flomax) to reduce the sudden urge and frequency of needing to use the bathroom but I still get up 2-3x a night and can't go more than an hour at work between bathroom breaks. Is this going to get worse after surgery? Also - once they remove the prostate, is that considered a cure? Below is a copy/paste of the biopsy results. I don't know my PSA but they've been up in the 10's and down in the low single digits as well. Seems to jump around a lot. DIAGNOSIS: PROSTATE, NEEDLE CORE BIOPSIES: A. LEFT LATERAL BASE: ‐ NO SIGNIFICANT PATHOLOGIC FINDINGS B. LEFT BASE: ‐ ADENOCARCINOMA, GLEASON SCORE 6 (3+3), IN 1 OF 3 CORES ‐ CARCINOMA IS 1 MM IN GREATEST DIMENSION, AND INVOLVES 20% OF THE CORE Narrative C‐L. RIGHT BASE, RIGHT LATERAL BASE, LEFT LATERAL MID, LEFT MID, RIGHT MID, RIGHT LATERAL MID, LEFT LATERAL APEX, LEFT APEX, RIGHT APEX, AND RIGHT LATERAL APEX : ‐ NO SIGNIFICANT PATHOLOGIC FINDINGS Thanks, John
Posts.Title: Biopsy is positive for cancer ... now what?

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies so far. I think the dr wants to do the surgery now(ish), instead of later, because I'm "young" and will recover quicker and easier. And yes, I don't remember how many da Vinci Prostatectomy's he's done but I do remember it was way up there and he's been writing articles on the procedure since 2004.
